title: Lily @ Life, Love, and Cupcakes Daphne Post author June Baby
directions: I made the butternut squash puree myself by peeling and cutting up a butternut squash. I steamed the butternut chunks for 20 minutes till soft. Cooking them is also an option. Then I put the steamed chunks in a food processor and turned them into a puree. Use 1/2 cup of this puree for this recipe.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit/175 degrees Celsius.
Grease a bread loaf or cake tin (30x12 cm / about 11x5 inches) with oil or butter.

Take a big mixing bowl and add: butternut puree, agave syrup, coconut oil (in a melted state), molasses, pumpkin pie spices and salt. Stir these ingredients together with a spoon or spatula. Using a food processor for making the batter will work fine too.
Put the spelt flour, the corn flour and the baking powder on top of the mix and pour the beer over it. The batter will start to bubble because of the beer.
Stir/process it all until you end up with smooth batter.
Pour the batter into the greased tin and bake for 40-45 minutes at 350 degrees Fahrenheit/175 degrees Celsius.
Once baked, let the bread cool off for 15 minutes before removing it from the tin.
ingredients: 1/2 teaspoon of salt (I used Himalayan salt)
1 small bottle of beer (250 ml/8.5 ounces)
